result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard James Matrious was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $379.00 fines/fees   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard James Matrious

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard James Matrious in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant does not wish to have an attorney.  State defendant waived his right to an attorney and makes stmt.  State makes stmt pleads and fine $579.00.   Defendant agrees.  Court addressed the defendant as to his right to an Atty.  Defendant does wish to waive his right to an Atty.  Court questions him as to his rights from plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court $579.00 fine to be paid today or 60 days to pay

Defendant failed to appear at a hearing and then a warrant was issued for arrest.  Court advised him as to his right to an Attorney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Richard James Matrious not in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PC found by court.
